ISSUE.TITLE: `healthcheck run` may log error when timer already exists
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: We've seen the below error in the system tests while working on https://github.com/containers/podman/pull/15687: > [+1061s] # #| > 'time="2022-09-08T05:39:35-05:00" level=error msg="Failed to start transient timer unit: Unit c26ee584b585cd1078cc26692d3f905006b65bda1ec1fc6e2fb19c5218a1d595.timer already exists.\n"' For now, the error will be lowered to debug level but we need to investigate the source of the issue.

BUGGYCOMMIT.MESSAGE: Merge pull request #15737 from Juneezee/refactor/os.ReadDir refactor: use `os.ReadDir` for lightweight directory reading

COMMIT.MESSAGE: health checks: restart timers Restart the health-check timers instead of starting them. This will surpress annoying errors stating that an already running timer cannot be started anymore. Also make sure that the transient units/timers are stopped and removed when stopping a container. Fixes: #15691 Signed-off-by: Valentin Rothberg <vrothberg@redhat.com>
